availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Hicks (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan A. Robertson Hicks in Henderson County, Kentucky, on November 6, 1834. Father of Elizabeth J. Hicks, Susan F. Hicks, Eliza J. Hicks, James A. Hicks, Arthur J. Hicks, Robertson Hicks, and William W. Hicks. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1, p. 299A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 189.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 169.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Hebbardsville Precinct, p. 77B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 001944390.
